channel.title: [PI]How Do I Edit The Background To The Client?[PI]
channel.description: Where Do I Edit The Background Of The Title? Client Sided.... PI!!

item.title: [PI]How Do I Edit The Background To The Client?[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Perses_Pkers Perses Pkers
item.description:
@Perses_Pkers wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]Why would you need to sharpen them?

And try using; http://www.pixlr.com/editor[/quote]ok Thank You But Now, How Do I Save It On There?

item.title: [PI]How Do I Edit The Background To The Client?[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Perses_Pkers Perses Pkers
item.description:
@Perses_Pkers wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]That’s because there’s a method in the client that flips it.

Just edit the background the the normal size, (765x503), and replace it.
If it shows up with the right side flipped, just edit the image and flip the ride side, then repack it in the cache.[/quote]Put It Back In As A PNG?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]How Do I Edit The Background To The Client?[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Perses_Pkers Perses Pkers
item.description:
@Perses_Pkers wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]Anywhere.

Just save it as a PNG file, then edit it.[/quote]Ok, But Its Only Half Of The Background?

item.source: [PI]How Do I Edit The Background To The Client?[PI]

item.title: [PI]How Do I Edit The Background To The Client?[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Perses_Pkers Perses Pkers
item.description:
@Perses_Pkers wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]You need to open the cache folder, through Tom’s Cache Suite.

Then go to View / Edit JaGeX archives > Title.jag;

You should see title.dat on the left side list.

Click on it, then click export on the right side.

Edit that, then re-import it to the cache, and repack the save.[/quote]It Doesn’t Say Export Anywhere.

Read full topic
